snippet.title: Free tennis and stroll into yesteryear at Retro Fantastic
snippet.content: THE Retro Fantastic on August 5 at the Mapleton Hall is an opportunity to join the members of the Mapleton Tennis Club for a genteel step back in time. The club is taking part in the Retro Fantastic by opening the Mapleton Tennis Courts to all adults over 18 years for a free game of tennis. You can make a day of it by playing a game and then wandering through the grounds of the hall, where the Retro Fantastic will be taking place from 9am-2pm. The Retro Fantastic is a celebration of the 50th anniversary of the naming of the Sunshine Coast, and is part of the Sunshine Coast's Festival of Small Community Halls. The theme of the day is 1967, and all visitors are encouraged to turn out in their best '60s fashions to help make the day even more authentic. A huge array of stalls, activities, displays, and entertainment - all in the theme of 1967 - will be sure to delight. There is something for everyone, including: a suitcase rummage (free sites); a 1960s fashion show; veteran cars; kids' activities such as kite making, face painting and old-time races; a craft table; a range of stalls from community groups with cakes, sweets, lucky dips, books, bric-a-brac and crafts; a '60-style kitchen, complete with milk shakes and spiders; devonshire teas; homemade ginger beer and lemonade; dance demonstrations; retro stalls; and musical entertainment. In the evening, the hall comes alive with a double-bill concert featuring the continental sounds of Mzaza on the Children of the Road tour, and the gpsy rhythms of Vardos.
